oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Martha White - 195y-mm-dd - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Martha White sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment, date unknown, circa early 1950s. Featuring Jud Collins (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), and performers Johnnie & Jack, the Crook Brothers, Hank Snow, Martha Carson, and the Blue Grass Boys (not present on this part). Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ernest Tubb; Johnnie & Jack; Crook Brothers; Hank Snow; Martha Carson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: "Opening theme -- Opening statement (Jud Collins) -- Fortunes In Memories (Ernest Tubb) -- Opening statement (Ernest Tubb) Ernest Tubb introduces Johnnie & Jack -- Poison Love (Johnnie & Jack) -- Martha White jingle -- Martha White commercial (Jud Collins) -- Martha White jingle -- Ernest Tubb introduces the Crook Brothers -- Boil Them Cabbage Down (Crook Brothers) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Hank Snow -- The Golden Rocket (Hank Snow) -- Martha White commercial (Jud Collins) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Martha Carson -- Rock-A My Soul (Martha Carson) -- Ernest Tubb talks -- I Will Miss You When You Go (Ernest Tubb)"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Martha White Foods; Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Collins, Jud; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Johnnie & Jack; Byrd, Billy; Carson, Martha; Blue Grass Boys; Crook Brothers; Snow, Hank
